Beliefs

Theories about belief
Here are academic theories about how and what we believe.
The Backfire Effect: Why Facts Don’t Always Change Minds
In a perfectly rational world, people who encounter evidence that challenges their beliefs would first evaluate this evidence, and then adjust their beliefs accordingly. However, in reality this is seldom the case.
A framework for First Principles Thinking
That was the first time I read about First Principles and it made me cry. Cry at my incompetence. But with an inkling of joy — I’d found another missing piece of the puzzle. That was over a year ago. I was a kid with a messed up thinking process — I hadn’t thought about thinking.
